channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Gloucester Ave at the end near Cecil Sharp House, 12th January
item.description:
Both of the no entry signs have been hit by a vehicle and are bent and leaning. The one on the right doesn’t look very secure. They need to both be repaired or replaced.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gloucester Avenue, Chalk Farm, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned Christmas Trees, 12th January
item.description:
Over 20 Christmas trees abandoned on the pavement of Sandbrook Road, they have been moved up and down the pavement but are now blocking access for buggies and wheelchair users. They have been there for nearly two weeks and more are being added each day.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Sandbrook Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Light not working in shelter, 12th January
item.description:
Light at bus shelter for Gloucester Ave towards Baker St isn’t working.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 15, Gloucester Avenue, Chalk Farm, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Central reservation on pedestrian crossing flooded, 12th January
item.description:
When it rains a large puddle forms on the crossing making it very difficult to get across the road dryly and safely. When it is very cold it freezes into ice and is very dangerous indeed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 65, Half Moon Lane, Dulwich Village, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Berkeley Avenue, West Heath, Greater London

item.title: Street light STILL not fixed, 12th January
item.description:
First reported light not working back in October 25 .. was advised FIXED on 7/11 which it wasnt so reported again and once again advised FIXED but it is still not working … ITS PITCH BLACK !!!!! AND DANGEROUS

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 53, Ellison Road, Longlands, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A crate has been on north side of Fenwick Grove for a week or more now, 12th January
item.description:
A crate has bedn left and there's a couple of other bits left near it. Thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Fenwick Grove, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The temporary traffic light is stuck on red, 12th January
item.description:
The temporary traffic light on crown lane going towards bromley common by salisbury road is stuck on red, so car was overtaking line of traffic, then after a while cars started to proceed as no oncoming traffic as the light just wasn't changing but the light was still red and also showing red in the direction going the other way when we had been through , this was about 9.55pm onwards on monday 12 jan
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crown Lane Spur, Southborough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: No mot since September 2025 car abandoned flat tyre, 12th January
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lincoln Road, Southbury, Greater London

item.title: Tree Root issue, 12th January
item.description:
A Public Tree root is Causing damage to driveway which may be taken up and replaced - this will reveal roots if they are the problem. Will you come and divert roots? What are the next steps.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Howards Crest Close, Shortlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Concrete lump on pavement - trip hazard -, 12th January
item.description:
My elderly mother tripped over the lump in the pavement outside Tesco in ballards lane on 11/1/26 she was helped by passers by and managed to get home. Today she has a sore knee which needs strapping and paracetamol to reduce pain. She has asked me to report it so no one else hurts themselves. Concrete lump on the paving caused the trip.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 21-29, Ballards Lane, Church End, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Deep and dangerous pothole cannot avoid, 12th January
item.description:
Pothole is in the left lane after turning left into Gloucester Road from Lyonsdown Road. The pothole is deep and dangerous and cannot be seen in the dark. It is towards the right hand side of the left lane and my car went down into the pothole even at a low speed as it’s soon after turning into the road and 20 mph speed limit. This urgently needs repairing to prevent damage or injury to vehicles or cyclists.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gloucester Road, New Barnet, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 4th time reporting this van parked illegally!!, 12th January
item.description:
4th time reporting this van parked illegally at Pynfolds Estate for multiple hours at a time or overnight. This is a resident of Pynfolds. How many times do we need to report this repeated behaviour?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Jamaica Road, Bermondsey, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
